Module Contents

class django.contrib.contenttypes.fields.GenericForeignKey(ct_field='content_type', fk_field='object_id', for_concrete_model=True)[source]

Bases: django.db.models.fields.mixins.FieldCacheMixin

Provide a generic many-to-one relation through the content_type and object_id fields.

This class also doubles as an accessor to the related object (similar to ForwardManyToOneDescriptor) by adding itself as a model attribute.

class django.contrib.contenttypes.fields.ReverseGenericManyToOneDescriptor[source]

Bases: django.db.models.fields.related.ReverseManyToOneDescriptor

Accessor to the related objects manager on the one-to-many relation created by GenericRelation.

In the example:

class Post(Model):
    comments = GenericRelation(Comment)

post.comments is a ReverseGenericManyToOneDescriptor instance.

related_manager_cls()[source]
django.contrib.contenttypes.fields.create_generic_related_manager(superclass, rel)[source]

Factory function to create a manager that subclasses another manager (generally the default manager of a given model) and adds behaviors specific to generic relations.
